identified-content.person: KAUFMAN, DR. ALISON BETH (DR. ALISON BETH HEGGENSTALLER)

block.p: Dr. Alison Beth Kaufman and Joseph Michael Heggenstaller are to be married today at Le Chateau, a restaurant in South Salem, N.Y. Judge Naomi Buchwald of Federal District Court in Manhattan is to officiate.

The bride, 26, was until earlier this month a veterinary intern at Equine Medicine in Centre Hall, Pa. Next month, she is to begin practicing at Hanover Shoe Farm, horse breeders in Hanover, Pa. She graduated cum laude from Tufts University and received her veterinary degree from Cornell University.

Dr. Alison Beth Kaufman and Joseph Michael Heggenstaller are to be married today at Le Chateau, a restaurant in South Salem, N.Y. Judge Naomi Buchwald of Federal District Court in Manhattan is to officiate.

The bride, 26, was until earlier this month a veterinary intern at Equine Medicine in Centre Hall, Pa. Next month, she is to begin practicing at Hanover Shoe Farm, horse breeders in Hanover, Pa. She graduated cum laude from Tufts University and received her veterinary degree from Cornell University.

She is a daughter of Elise and Alan Kaufman of Cross River, N.Y. The bride's father is the chief of the criminal division at the United States attorney's office in Manhattan. Her mother is a social worker in New Rochelle, N.Y., for the Westchester County Department of Health.

The bridegroom, 29, worked until last week at Gannett Fleming, an engineering company in Harrisburg, Pa., where he generated maps on computer, using geographic information systems. Next month, he is to begin in a similar position for the municipal government in York Township, Pa. He graduated from Shippensburg University in Shippensburg, Pa.

He is a son of Nancy Heggenstaller of Millheim, Pa., and the late Donald F. Heggenstaller. The bridegroom's mother is a production line worker at Gettig Technologies, a medical supplies manufacturing company in Spring Mills, Pa. His father was the publisher of The Millheim Journal, a former weekly newspaper.
